instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01700: What is 820-01700? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.CD3217: What is CD3217? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  Left USB-C ports charge but no data
threads.message:
This was a liquid damaged machine but no liquid damage was on LB.  Left ports were replaced.
The left USB-C ports do not communicate USB data but [U]do charg[/U]e the unit.

None of the zener diodes are damaged on the data lines and the fault covers both left ports.
Looking at the schematics I see <CHIP>U2800</CHIP> is on this channel as well as both the <CHIP>CD3217</CHIP>'s

Looks SOC <CHIP>U3900</CHIP> "T2" is also in the mix here.

Where do I start?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  Left USB-C ports charge but no data
threads.message:
Lost both USB 2.0 and 3.0 communication modes?
Just in case, test left HDMI output.
